title: Kupittaan jäähalli
text:
Kupittaan jäähalli () is an <a href="arena">arena</a> in <a href="Turku">Turku</a>, <a href="Finland">Finland</a>. It is primarily used for <a href="ice%20hockey">ice hockey</a>, and is the home arena of <a href="TuTo">TuTo</a>. It was originally opened in 1973 and held 5,500 people.
History.
The first <a href="artificial%20ice">artificial ice</a> field in Kupittaan jäähalli was <a href="Construction">constructed</a> in 1962; this, however, was an outdoor field where players were at the mercy of the weather. However, since the field was <a href="Artificiality">artificially</a> frozen, the opening <a href="Season%20%28sports%29">season</a> was much longer than with natural ice. The actual arena was constructed in 1973, allowing teams to play indoors. The new arena with a <a href="Fan%20%28person%29">spectator</a> capacity of 3,000 was inaugurated on November 2006.
Teams.
Ice hockey teams <a href="TPS%20%28ice%20hockey%29">TPS</a>, <a href="TuTo">TuTo</a>, and several other teams have played in this venue. When the new <a href="Elys%C3%A9e%20Arena">Elysée Arena</a> was constructed in 1990, TPS moved there. Since then, Kupittaan jäähalli has been known as the <a href="home%20arena">home arena</a> for <a href="TuTo">TuTo</a>.
New arena.
The last games in the old arena were played in the <a href="Spring%20%28season%29">spring</a> of 2005. The new arena with spectator capacity of 3,000 was inaugurated on November 2006.
